parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.value: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/122.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

parameters.content:
## ⚙️ Section 1: **Trigger & Data Fetching**

This section is responsible for **automatically starting the workflow** and **retrieving Fiverr gig listings** for UGC content creators.

---

### ⏰ 1. `Daily Fiverr Scrape Trigger`

> **🧠 Purpose:** Starts the entire workflow on a scheduled basis.

📌 **Details:**

* 🔁 Runs automatically at specified intervals (daily, hourly, etc.)
* 🔌 Acts as the starting point of your automation pipeline
* 🧩 Useful for keeping your dataset fresh without manual intervention

🔧 **Example configuration:**

* `Frequency:` Every 24 hours
* `Time:` 09:00 AM UTC

---

### 🌐 2. `Fetch Fiverr Search Results`

> **🧠 Purpose:** Makes an HTTP GET request to Fiverr to fetch search results for UGC content creators.

📌 **Details:**

* 🌍 **Endpoint:** `https://www.fiverr.com/search/gigs?query=UGC%20content%20creator`
* 🧾 **Method:** `GET`
* 📦 **Returns:** Raw HTML content of the search result page
* 🔐 Supports headers (e.g., user-agent) if needed to bypass scraping blocks

🧰 **Pro tips:**

* Consider rotating user agents or using proxies for better reliability
* Use query parameters to refine your search (e.g., country, category)

---

## 🧠 Section 2: **HTML Parsing & Data Logging**

This section focuses on **extracting useful data** from the raw HTML and then **storing it securely** in Google Sheets for future reference.

---

### 🧱 3. `Extract Gig Data from HTML`

> **🧠 Purpose:** Parses the fetched HTML and extracts key gig details.

📌 **Extracted Fields:**

* 💵 **Price** – Starting price of the gig
* 🧑‍🎨 **Seller** – Name of the gig creator
* 📝 **Title** – Gig headline
* 🔗 **Gig URL** – Direct link to the gig

🔍 **How it works:**

* Uses **CSS selectors** or **XPath** to find the right HTML nodes
* Grabs the values and passes them as structured data to the next node

⚠️ **Note:** You may need to update selectors if Fiverr changes its HTML structure.

---

### 📊 4. `Append Gig Data to Sheet`

> **🧠 Purpose:** Stores the extracted gig data in a connected Google Sheet.

📌 **Details:**

* 📁 Appends each gig as a new row
* 🧾 Keeps a log of all scrapes for historical analysis
* 🔄 Works with dynamic ranges – no manual sheet setup needed

🔐 **Sheet Features:**

* 🧹 You can apply filters or conditional formatting
* 🗂 Consider using a timestamp column for easier tracking

---

## ✅ Summary

Your workflow is a **powerful automation** that:

* 🔄 Runs automatically on schedule
* 🌐 Fetches Fiverr UGC gigs
* 🧱 Parses and extracts valuable info
* 📊 Logs everything in an easy-to-analyze Google Sheet

Let me know if you'd like help adding:

* 📌 Deduplication logic
* 🔔 Email/Slack alerts when new gigs are found
* 🧼 Data cleanup/formatting in Sheets

=======================================
            WORKFLOW ASSISTANCE
=======================================
For any questions or support, please contact:
    Yaron@nofluff.online

Explore more tips and tutorials here:
   - YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos
   - LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/
=======================================

_metadata.name: Automated Fiverr UGC Market Research: Track Gigs with Google Sheets
